translations: v.听；抽穗（ear 的过去分词）

phrs.translation: 随机行事；无计划地进行
乳臭未干的；少不更事的；初出茅庐的
对...听觉灵敏；对...有鉴赏力
[口语]耳朵被打肿，(被打得)青肿的耳朵
耳朵发烧(意指有人背后议论) [戏谑语]

sentences.sentence: The third has a few dog-eared books, which are marked from front to back.
sentences.translation: 第三种人有几本折角的书，它们从头到尾都被做了标记。

sentences.sentence: Based on its body size, a bat-like the greater mouse-eared bat would be expected to live four years.
sentences.translation: 根据它的体型，像大耳蝠这样的蝙蝠可以活4年。

sentences.sentence: Armed only with a dog-eared NEWSWEEK ID, I ambled through the gates of the National Assembly last week.
sentences.translation: 上周，我带着一张折了角的《新闻周刊》ID（NEWSWEEK ID），悠闲地走进了国民大会（National Assembly）的大门。
